Generated Narrative: ValueSet R5-citation-classification-type-for-R4

This value set expansion contains 3 concepts.

http://hl7.org/fhir/citation-classification-type5.0.0  medline-ownerMEDLINE Citation OwnerThe party responsible for creating and validating the MEDLINE citation

name: R5CitationClassificationTypeForR4
title: Cross-version ValueSet R5.CitationClassificationType for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version ValueSet represents content from `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/citation-classification-type|5.0.0` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This value set is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
value set `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/citation-classification-type|5.0.0` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source value set is bound to the following FHIR R5 elements:
* `Citation.classification.type` as Extensible

Across FHIR versions, the value set has been mapped as:
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/citation-classification-type|5.0.0`
* `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/citation-classification-type|4.3.0`

The following concepts are not included in this cross-version definition because they have valid representations
* _no concepts_

Following are the generation technical comments:
All concepts in the comparison are listed as identical.
The source and target value sets have the same number of active concepts (3).
FHIR ValueSet `http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/citation-classification-type|5.0.0`, defined in FHIR R5 does not have any mapping to FHIR R4
